content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of such function:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Find all code blocks
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```(.*?)\n(.*?)\n```", md))
    blocks = map(x-> x[2], matches)  # Extract the second part of each match (the actual code block)
    
    if isempty(blocks) return "" end # Return empty string if no code blocks found
    
    # Remove code fences and join all blocks together with newline
    result = join([replace(block, r"^```.*?\n|```$", "") for block in blocks], "\n")
    
    return result
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all the code blocks in your markdown document and then removes the fences. After joining all of these blocks together, it will return a string containing all the extracted and joined code. 

Please note that if there are multiple consecutive code blocks without any text or whitespace separating them, this function may not work correctly due to how regular expressions work. In such case, you would need to handle the text in between separately.
